intro: Millettia thyrsiflora, commonly known as the thrysothyrse, is a deciduous tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant produces elongated, woody pods that contain several elliptical seeds. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
